questions.question_text: Convert the given fractional numbers to per cents. (a) 1/8 (b) 5/4 (c) 3/40 (d) 2/7
hints: Convert fraction to equivalent fraction with denominator 100

questions.question_text: Convert the given decimal fractions to per cents. (a) 0.65 (b) 2.1 (c) 0.02 (d) 12.35
hints: Move decimal point two places to the right

questions.question_text: Estimate what part of the figures is coloured and hence find the per cent which is coloured. (i) [figure described] (ii) [figure described] (iii) [figure described]
hints: Count shaded parts vs total parts

questions.question_text: Find: (a) 15% of 250 (b) 1% of 1 hour (c) 20% of ₹2500 (d) 75% of 1 kg
Find the whole quantity if (a) 5% of it is 600. (b) 12% of it is ₹1080. (c) 40% of it is 500 km. (d) 70% of it is 14 minutes. (e) 8% of it is 40 litres.
hints: Set up equation: (percentage/100) × whole = given part
Solve for whole by dividing given part by percentage/100

questions.question_text: Convert given per cents to decimal fractions and also to fractions in simplest forms: (a) 25% (b) 150% (c) 20% (d) 5%
hints: Write percentage as fraction with denominator 100

questions.question_text: In a city, 30% are females, 40% are males and remaining are children. What per cent are children?
hints: Check that all percentages sum to 100%

questions.question_text: Out of 15,000 voters in a constituency, 60% voted. Find the percentage of voters who did not vote. Can you now find how many actually did not vote?
hints: Calculate actual number: percentage × total voters
Convert percentage to decimal before multiplying

questions.question_text: Meeta saves ₹4000 from her salary. If this is 10% of her salary. What is her salary?
hints: Check: 10% of calculated salary should equal 4000

questions.question_text: A local cricket team played 20 matches in one season. It won 25% of them. How many matches did they win?

Tell what is the profit or loss in the following transactions. Also find profit per cent or loss per cent in each case. (a) Gardening shears bought for ₹250 and sold for ₹325. (b) A refrigerator bought for ₹12,000 and sold at ₹13,500. (c) A cupboard bought for ₹2,500 and sold at ₹3,000. (d) A skirt bought for ₹250 and sold at ₹150.
hints: Compare SP and CP to determine profit/loss

questions.question_text: Convert each part of the ratio to percentage: (a) 3 : 1 (b) 2 : 3 : 5 (c) 1:4 (d) 1 : 2 : 5
The population of a city decreased from 25,000 to 24,500. Find the percentage decrease.
Arun bought a car for ₹3,50,000. The next year, the price went upto ₹3,70,000. What was the Percentage of price increase?
hints: Calculate increase = new price - original price
Express as percentage with proper units

questions.question_text: I buy a T.V. for ₹10,000 and sell it at a profit of 20%. How much money do I get for it?
Juhi sells a washing machine for ₹13,500. She loses 20% in the bargain. What was the price at which she bought it?
hints: Set up equation: SP = CP - (20% of CP)

questions.question_text: (i) Chalk contains calcium, carbon and oxygen in the ratio 10:3:12. Find the percentage of carbon in chalk. (ii) If in a stick of chalk, carbon is 3g, what is the weight of the chalk stick?
hints: (i) Find total ratio parts, carbon part/total, convert to percentage
(ii) If carbon is 3g and ratio part is 3, find weight per ratio part, multiply by total ratio parts

questions.question_text: Amina buys a book for ₹275 and sells it at a loss of 15%. How much does she sell it for?
Find the amount to be paid at the end of 3 years in each case: (a) Principal = ₹1,200 at 12% p.a. (b) Principal = ₹7,500 at 5% p.a.
hints: Calculate simple interest: I = (P × R × T)/100
Apply formula for each case separately

questions.question_text: What rate gives ₹280 as interest on a sum of ₹56,000 in 2 years?
hints: Use simple interest formula: I = (P × R × T)/100
Rearrange to find R: R = (I × 100)/(P × T)

questions.question_text: If Meena gives an interest of ₹45 for one year at 9% rate p.a.. What is the sum she has borrowed?
hints: Use simple interest formula: I = (P × R × T)/100
Rearrange to find P: P = (I × 100)/(R × T)
